intro: Clompanus madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
